title: Definitions
context: §471-1 Definitions. As used in this chapter: &ldquo;Animal&rdquo; means any animal except human beings. &ldquo;Board&rdquo; means the board of veterinary examiners of the State. &ldquo;Continuing education courses&rdquo; means courses approved by the board of veterinary examiners, the Hawaii Veterinary Medical Association, the American Association of Veterinary State Boards&rsquo; Registry, or other board-approved organizations. &ldquo;Credit hour&rdquo; means, except as otherwise provided, the value assigned to fifty minutes of instruction. &ldquo;Practice of veterinary medicine&rdquo; means the diagnosis or treatment for the prevention, cure, or relief of, or the giving of advice concerning, a disease, pain, injury, deformity, or other physical condition of an animal, or a change of a physical characteristic of an animal for cosmetic or utility purposes. It includes medical, surgical, and dental care of animals. &ldquo;Veterinarian&rdquo; means a person duly licensed in the State to engage in the practice of veterinary medicine. [L 1949, c 280, pt of §1; RL 1955, §73-1; HRS §471-1; am L 2012, c 306, §2]
